9.14.24  3:04 am   ever noticed how most of the time words with q have it either at the start or at the end?

      no it doesn't feel that way for me. certainly a lot of words end with 'que'

9.14.24  2:49 am   do you actually like times new roman? (the font)

     it's ok. it's nice to use sometimes just because of the classic vibes, and it's very clean. i'd say if you have to use a serif then times new roman is the most trusted standard, let's say

9.14.24  2:26 am   As I write more songs, I'm finding it's really easy for me to write choruses and bridges the repetitive or most important parts of the song that reveal the core way that I feel about something. These are usually the things I write first, the first things I come up with. As I then have to expand on those ideas, I find it's difficult to put together verses or pre-choruses. I feel like I'm out of things to say. I think part of the problem is that these are usually the parts of other peoeple's songs I find least interesting. Like, my favorite "musical moments" are often choruses or bridges, and I don't usually think about verses. Ofcourse there are great lyrical moments that I think about all the time, but those are few and far between I suppose. It's like, I just wrote the best part of this song, and now you want me to... write a less interesting part? I don't know how to expand on my ideas in that way. Does that make sense? What do I do?

     the first thing i'd absolutely recommend to any songwriter, forget everything you know about the names of the sections. "chorus", "verse", these terms play dirty and no one truly knows which is which, or if songs even need to have them, whatever. The important thing is, you've come up with the most important part, the best part. so you know you have that to offer. make the rest of the song about how good the main part is, and how excited you are to have people hear it. remember this 'additional contents' can be as short as you want, it can be after or before, in between, anywhere, and it does not have to be called a 'verse' or 'pre-whatever'. any amount of anything anywhere, in service of the main gift piece you are offering. in fact it's always good to first just ask yourself if maybe you don't even need anything else. and then just do whatever you need to deliver the goods. it's like you've got the birthday gift, all you need is the box. just put it in something and get it there, so it can be opened and enjoyed

9.14.24  1:57 am   how accurately would you say you can ascertain the emotional state of a questioner just by reading their question?

      on average, 50%

9.13.24  10:58 pm   would you rather make part of a song using a bachata or merengue beat, or alternatively the secret third option where you manage to use both and make it sound good

      that third way is the way i normally work, but without worrying whether the styles ever had names, because really it's a spectrum anyway so you could never name every shade, even if there were finite shades

9.13.24  5:45 pm   What's a song lyric that has a good slant rhyme? (I think it's called a slant rhyme - like when two words don't really rhyme but can sound like they kinda sorta do with the right pronunciation and inflection)

      this part of the literature on rhyming seems incoherent to me, in more ways than i can even describe. it always seems to completely overlook the things that do matter, and fixate on the things that don't matter. and bizarrely, most people's examples of 'slant rhymes' seem to slant the parts that ruin it, while actually keeping the parts the same that were already ruining it by being too much the same. anyway thanks for reading

9.13.24  5:23 pm   Do you enjoy using analogies as a method of explaining concepts that could be explained simply otherwise, because the analogies might help make the journey towards understanding those concepts more interesting?

      no. analogies are mostly for when the simpler explanation was not being understood

I've been going through this for last few years and it's prevented me from making significant progress on anything because I keep bouncing from one pursuit to another. How do I get rid of this FOMO and just specialize

      one way or another, you have to calm down, if only just a little

9.13.24  2:32 pm   hi bill, i wanna get into music and acting. how do i break the news to my parents?

9.13.24  10:00 am   If there was a guy who thought "in my next life I'll think about the fact that I had this thought" and then I think "there was a guy who thought that in his next life he would be a guy who thinks about the fact that he had this thought", does that make me the reincarnation of that guy? 

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

9.13.24  9:13 am   is there a point where you just know everything about life (and/or music)? thank you mr. wurtz
